title: Chocolate-Dipped Figs
introduction: Chocolate-Dipped Figs are a delightful after-dinner indulgence, featuring moist dried figs that are stuffed with a toasted almond and a piece of candied orange peel, then dipped in rich bittersweet chocolate. This treat is perfect for those who appreciate the contrast of sweet figs, crunchy almonds, and citrusy orange peel, all enveloped in decadent chocolate.
ingredients: 4 ounces bittersweet chocolate, chopped or broken into small pieces
instructions: 1. Line a tray with wax paper and set a wire cooling rack on top. Make a small slit in the base of each fig. Insert an almond and a piece of orange peel into the figs. Pinch the slit closed.
2. In the top half of a double boiler set over simmering water, melt the chocolate and butter, about 5 minutes. Remove from the heat and stir until smooth. Let stand 5 minutes.
3. Dip each fig in the melted chocolate and place on the wire rack. When all of the figs have been dipped, place the tray in the refrigerator to set the chocolate, about 1 hour.
4. Place the figs in an airtight container, separating each layer with wax paper. Store in the refrigerator up to 30 days.
